New Records: Argentina claimed a 3-0 home win over Chile, strengthening their grip on top of the South American World Cup qualifying.
Key Match Events: Argentina opened the scoring three minutes after the break, when Alexis Mac Allister sent the ball into the net first-time off a cross from Julian Alvarez, who also got on the scoresheet with a long-range effort in the 84th minute.
Substitute Paulo Dybala found the net in stoppage time to seal the victory.
Pre-Game Insights: Argentina played without talismans Lionel Messi and Angel Di Maria, who received a tribute at the Monumental stadium after his international retirement.
Post-Match Reflections: The World Cup winners are now five clear of second-placed Uruguay who host Paraguay on Friday.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Argentina will play at Colombia in a rematch of the Copa America final on Tuesday, while Chile hosts Bolivia, who beat Venezuela earlier on Thursday.
Others: Argentina's performance was described as dominant and untroubled, despite the absence of key players.
